result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deveto Antwan Rivers

Defendant Deveto Antwan Rivers in court.  
Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Deveto Antwan Rivers.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 


Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.
Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Deveto Antwan Rivers in court.  
Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Deveto Antwan Rivers.  
Attorney Erika Strebel for Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Status Conference. 
Defense counsel request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Parties advised the court does not have any trial dates available at this time and ordered case adjourned.
Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates will be determined at the next court proceedings.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19, Room 313 of the Safety Building.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deveto Antwan Rivers in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Derfense in receipt of discovery and request additional time to review and discuss with the  defendant.
Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19. Status Conference scheduled September 8, 2022 at 8:30am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 062592,
Payable Number: 1018224,
Receipt Number: 22RP027431,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Deveto Antwan Rivers in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Deveto Antwan Rivers in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-21-2022 @1:30p
